meanings.definition: Move at a speed faster than a walk.
meanings.sent1: I run to catch the bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: She likes to run in the park for exercise.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to run after its tail, looking silly.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to run faster when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The river runs swiftly through the valley.

meanings.definition: Operate or be in charge of.
meanings.sent1: I run my own small business from home.
meanings.sent2: He will run the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to run a lemonade stand on the corner.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts run the show in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The manager runs a tight ship at the restaurant.

meanings.sent1: The road will run straight through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The fence runs along the property line.
meanings.sent3: The colors of the rainbow run beautifully across the sky.
meanings.sent4: Lines of code run down the computer screen.
meanings.sent5: The veins run beneath the skin like tiny rivers.

meanings.definition: Be in or reach a specified state or condition.
meanings.sent1: Her fever will run its course and then break.
meanings.sent2: The project is set to run smoothly if we stick to the plan.
meanings.sent3: The car's engine decided to run hot on the highway.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can run high during a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset run deep and vibrant in the sky.
